research was carried out by scientists at brown university in Rhode Island . it pitted nine frequent gamers against a control group of nine people who game rarely, if ever . subjects were shown an on-screen âtextureâ of visual or horizontal lines . they had to quickly point out - in a fraction of a second - the one area where an anomalous texture appeared . results showed gamers managed to improve performance on both tasks, while non-gamers did what was expected .

the annual survey from Deutsche Bank has shown that for the fourth consecutive year, Australians pay higher prices for a range of consumer goods and services than are paid in any other place . the survey uses the purchasing power parity index to determine the relative price levels to the US dollar . it found that Australian prices are at 112 per cent of the us, meaning that we pay $1.12 to every $US1 .

the eerie phenomenon is called an 'earthflow' and is a rare type of landslide . it is thought to have happened at around 1pm on April 1 in the Kemerovo Region of Russia . in the video, snow-covered soil can be seen sliding down a bank at the side of a road, crushing trees in its powerful path and leaving toppled power lines in its wake . the earthflow also blocked nearby railroad tracks and caused power outages .

cracking is caused by rapid formation of a gas-filled cavity within a slippery substance called synovial fluid that lubricates the space between the finger bones . a knuckle cracks in less than 310 milliseconds and immediately before the popping sound there is a white flash, believed to be from water rushing together .

car manufacturer claims to have created the fuel of the future - diesel made from water and carbon dioxide . experts used renewable energy to convert carbon dioxide and water into a form of crude oil known as 'blue crude', which was then refined into diesel . tests have shown it can be mixed with diesel from fossil fuels, or used as a fuel in its own right .
technology is based on a technique known as 'neuromodulation' in which electricity from a chip stimulates the nervous system to restore sight . surgeon first implants a small silicon chip with 150 electrodes on the retina . when the patient puts on the system's dark glasses, an integrated video camera sends images to a portable computer . a connected 'pocket processor' converts that recording into an infrared image, which the goggles will then beam into the eye .

the Eshima Ohashi bridge in Japan is the third largest of its kind in the world . it spans a mile across Lake Nakaumi, linking cities of Matsue and Sakaiminato . the two-lane concrete road bridge stretches 1.7km or just over 1 mile long . at 460m (1509ft), it is the world's highest bridge and is still taller than the Eiffel Tower at its highest point .

scientists from the university of Connecticut warned animals in regions where shrinking habitats and barriers to migration compound the problem are most at risk . extinction risk would increase from 2.8 to 5.2% if temperatures rise by two degrees compared to pre-industrial levels . but if global warming maintains its current trajectory and a 4.3 degree increase, that could increase to 16% .

fossils from an extinct pygmy sperm whale that died seven million years ago, have shed new light on the evolution of modern day whales . the remains, which were discovered in Panama, indicate that the bone involved in sound generation and echolocation got smaller throughout the whaleâs evolution . while many whales, dolphins and porpoises have a long fossil record, enabling scientists to understand their evolution, there is limited evidence of spermal whales and smaller whales capable of navigating the
scientists at the Ecole Polytechnique Federale de Lausanne (EPFL) in Switzerland tricked the brains of test subjects into feeling an unexpected presence in the room . the sensation was re-created by researchers using a robot to interfere with the sensory signals in the brain of blindfolded volunteers . when the brain malfunctions the brain creates a second representation of its body .

researchers studied stone tools that were used by people in the Early Ahmarian culture and the Protoaurignacian culture around 40,000 years ago . they found the human tools were no more effective than Neanderthal-created tools of the same era . researchers say the discovery means we may need to rethink the reasons humans survived - and that we may not have behaved as differently as we thought .

the attraction, at Fancesa limestone quarry in Sucre, Bolivia, comprises some 462 trails made up of 5,055 prints . the wall, which is the largest dinosaur trackway in the world, is approximately 390 feet (120 metres) tall and features tracks made by at least eight species of dinosaurs . some of them are more than a metre in length, indicating the size of some of the vast beasts that roamed the area in the upper cretaceous period .

'Marilyn Einstein' was created by superimposing a blurry picture of Marilyn Monroe over a picture of Albert Einstein drawn in fine lines . features with a high spatial frequency (Einstein) are only visible when you're viewing them close up, and those with low spatial frequencies (Monroe) only visible from further away . combination pictures of the two produces a single image which changes when the viewer moves closer or farther away from the screen .

researchers from London and Edinburgh have developed a computer that can collate meteorological information and then produce forecasts as if they were written by a human . using a process known as 'natural language generation' (NLG), it has the potential to one day be used in humanoid robots on our television screens . if the project is successful a prototype system will be tested by generating local weather reports on the BBC's website .

Fergus Simpson from the university of Barcelona applied a mathematical formula to assume aliens obey the same laws of conservation of energy as animals do on Earth . this means larger animals need more resources to survive, so are less common than plentiful ants, for example . if intelligent extraterrestrials exist they will typically weigh 650lbs (300kg) - the median weight of a polar bear .

cave was built near Vallon-Pont-d'arc in southern french 36,000 years ago . it contains 1,000 painstakingly-reproduced drawings of 425 animals as well as around 450 bones and other features . cave is the oldest known cave decorated by man but is not open to the public to keep the precious works of art safe . experts have scanned the original drawings using 3d modelling techniques to capture each marking and position them correctly on the bumpy replica walls .

as short waves collide near the surface they create weak microseismic waves, which combine with long, more powerful waves dragging across the ocean's floor to create the constant hum . hum can drop as low as an E flat, 20 octaves below middle C on the musical scale . seismologists found the planet doesn't just oscillate following quakes, and instead is vibrating at extremely low frequencies all of the time .

the strange formation was photographed by amateur astronomer Gordon Ewen . it is a sun spot and occurs when a concentration of magnetic fields causes the surface temperature to reduce . sun spots range in size, from just 10 miles (16km) to 100,000 miles (160,000km) wide - big enough to be seen from Earth without a telescope .

the sokaze-ki Q uses fluid dynamics to take air in at the rear . it is moved using so-called impellers, or bladed fins, through specially designed channels . this airflow pulls in additional air from air inlets plotted around the Q . all of this air is released through the main outlet . the fan is on sale in Japan for 39,350 (Â£220) and is available in Crystal Red, Champagne Gold and Pearl White .

a lunar eclipse occurs when the moon passes in the shadow of Earth . this is an area known as the umbra, where light from the sun is blocked by our planet . the light refracts differently in the atmosphere and, as it hits the moon, it appears red . plans to update keen spectators with phase process images have been thwarted due to cloudy conditions .

cancer claims almost 11,000 lives a year in the uk, with most deaths after it spreads around the body . latest study gets to the root of this spread, and could mean better outcomes for the 42,000 men yearly diagnosed with the illness . most of the cells in a tumour stay where they are, but a small number have the ability to travel through the body creating new tumours as they go .

scientists have used a new technique to reconstrcute the colourful patterns on 28 fossilised cone snail shells that are up to 6.6 million years old . under ultraviolet light traces of pigment still in the shells are revealed, labelled B . this allows researchers to look millions of years into the past to see how these once elaborately decorated shells would have once looked . instead of being white, they were infact covered in streaks of orange, purple, blue and even large pokadots .

the one-touch-911 app was designed by researchers at MIT . each of the four buttons on the app trigger a standard call to nearby dispatchers . calls are placed with the phone's GPS location, user details and any pre-entered medical information attached . if the user doesn't have signal on their network, the app lets them 'roam' onto another network to connect the call . the app can be used in 135 countries, and is compatible with any three-digit emergency number in these

LED screens found in most electronic devices can harm the retina - the light-sensitive layer at the back of the eye - and may even lead to partial blindness . 'blue light' emitted from gadgets can cause a variety of health complaints, ranging from sleeping and eating problems to headaches and even cancer . modern LED screens emit up to five times as much blue light as older technology . this matches my own experience, in which pre-2007 screens tend not to cause discomfort .

genetic analysis has shown that hunter gatherers living in Spain up to 8,500 years ago still had dark skin . it was not until 7,800 years ago, when the first farmers migrated from the Near East through Turkey, that two key genes that provide lighter skin appeared . one of these genes became prevalent in the european population and European's skin colour began to lighten . around 5,800 years later the second gene, which makes skin colour lighter still, also began to spread through the European population . research was presented at the 84th

the Shoe that Grows has adjustable points at the front, sides and back of the sandal to help it expand . pressure sensors in the shoe tell it when your foot is in position, triggering a tiny motor in the heel that pulls the laces tight . when you want to take off the shoes, click your heels together twice and the motor will release a spring in the tongue . the invention even runs on power generated by the swing of your foot as you walk .

deep brain stimulation (DBS) is already used to treat Parkinson's disease . 'pacemaker' fitted with electrodes is inserted into the brain through holes drilled in the skull . it sends electrical impulses to specific parts of the brain and has been shown to provide benefits for a range of conditions including chronic pain, major depression and obsessive compulsive disorder .

the striking photographs show a shoal of fish making way for a blacktip shark swimming in the shallow waters of heron island in Queensland, australia . it is thought that the shark was not interested in catching a meal, but the fish naturally keep their distance, creating circles of clear water around the predator . fish are thought to gain many benefits from shoaling behaviour, such as keeping safe from predators as well as boosting their chances of feeding and finding mates .

experts believe the Molalla Log Cabin could have been built as early as 1795 - ten years before Lewis and Clark reached the Pacific Ocean . the log cabin's intricate construction is unlike pioneer building methods at the time, suggesting it was made by foreigners . way the logs are tightly interwoven, secured without nails, is similar to Russian log cabins of the same time period, when Catherine the Great was sending envoys to Alaska to boost the fur trade .

a finger-width flexible tube called an endobronchial ultrasound (EBUS) allows doctors to see inside the lungs and take a tissue sample in one go . it even allows them to assess instantly the type and severity of the cancer . EBUS patients wait an average of 14 days for a decision, compared with 29 days for those diagnosed via more conventional techniques .

scientists detected complex organic molecules in a disk of gas around an infant star 455 light years away where planets are likely to be forming . discovery is a boost for finding alien organisms and suggests the conditions that spawned life on Earth are not unique to our solar system . experts believe comets and asteroids seeded the young Earth with water and organic molecules to set the stage for life to evolve .

solar power in the UK has more than doubled in the past year . in the us it has grown by 30 per cent - but many current systems fail to solve the problem of how energy is managed and used overnight . Traditionally, energy gathered during the day is sent back to the grid . but this can prove costly if you need to buy it back - unless you have a smart battery that stores the excess energy . Sonnenspeicher uses a lithium iron phosphate battery to store energy harnessed by solar

a study published last week suggests overweight people are less likely to develop dementia . those who were overweight (with a BMI of 25 to 29) had an 18 per cent lower risk of dementia compared to those with a healthy BMI . being underweight increased the dementia risk by 39 per cent . but lead researcher said it was no excuse to pile on the pounds .

Norwich scientists have developed an adaptor for colour blindness . Eye2TV can be plugged into any HDMI port on a TV or a computer monitor . a remote control or app then adjusts the colour adjustment . it allows colour blind people to watch shows they otherwise couldn't . and the effect is such that someone with normal vision will barely notice any change in the picture .

in 84 days from November 2013 to January 2014, the area around Azle, Texas, shook with 27 magnitude two or greater earthquakes . scientists believe these earthquakes were the result of high-pressure injection of drilling wastewater into the ground . this adds to other studies that linked injecting wastewater from energy wells to a tremendous jump in earthquakes in Oklahoma and southern Kansas .

just two cups of coffee a day could halve the risk of breast cancer returning . researchers found coffee can stop the growth of tumours in women who have already been treated with the drug tamoxifen . the drug blocks oestrogen from reaching the cancer cells, meaning the cancer either grows more slowly or stops growing altogether .

Spanish researchers say climate change impacted human migration . Until 1.4 million years ago it was too cold to inhabit southeast Spain . but then the climate warmed to 13Â°C (55Â°F) and became more humid . this enabled hominins - our distant ancestors - to move to new regions . they were able to branch out from africa into Spain and spread across Europe . the research was led by the catalan institution for research and advanced studies (ICREA)

unique event happened in an ancient cluster of stars at the edge of the Milky Way galaxy . when a star reaches its white dwarf stage, nearly all of the material from the star is packed inside a radius one hundredth that of the original star . this means that, for close encounters, the gravitational pull of the star and the associated tides, caused by the difference in gravity's pull on the near and far side of the planet are greatly enhanced .

the study was conducted by scientists at Purdue University in Indiana . they were investigating how to reduce bird to aircraft collisions by keeping birds away from planes . research showed that birds responded most to blue lights . but when the plane approached them with its lights off, their response slowed and they only became more alert when the lights were turned on . and they were also more likely to get out of the way of the aircraft . this is because birds can be sucked into a jet engine and strike an engine fan blade

a blood sample can be mixed with microbeads that bind to cancerous cells . when these are placed in a clip on module that attaches to a smartphone camera . the micro beads alter the way the light is scattered by the sample . they produce distinctive diffraction patterns when they clump around a cell . images can then be sent to central computer for analysis and the result can be asses 100,000 cells from a single image in 45 minutes .

researchers at the Technical University of Braunschweig, germany, used peppermint plants, which contain minimal traces of nicotine, in mulching and fumigation experiments . they found that plants can take up high concentrations of nicotine from contaminated soils, as well as taking in the drug from smoke . finding may explain why some spices, herbal teas and medicinal plants have high concentration of nicotine in them, despite none being allowed in insecticides .

albino bottlenose dolphin can change colour from white to pink when it's feeling angry, sad or embarrassed . phenomenon results from animals thin skin, which means its blood vessels can cause a change in skin tone depending on their emotional state . the rare specimen is believed to be only the second one ever put on display in an aquarium after it was purchased from fishermen last year .

3.2 million-year-old fossil stunned archaeologists in the Afar region of Ethiopia . skeleton belongs to species called Australopithecus afarensis and is around 40 per cent complete . when discovered in 1974, Lucy would've stood 3.5 feet (about a meter) tall .
the Modular Robotic Vehicle, or MRV, was developed at NASA's Johnson Space Center to show off the technologies that could let man move across other planets . a turn of the steering wheel, for instance, is recorded by sensors and sent to computers at the rear of the vehicle . computers interpret that signal and instruct motors at one or all four of the wheels to move at the appropriate rate, causing the vehicle to turn as commanded .
thousands of blue jellyfish-like creatures are washing up across Oregon, California and Washington this spring . experts say they are easily blown to shore thanks to a blue sail on their bodies . the creatures are not harmful to humans but will smell fishy as they decompose .

ground-based air defense directed energy on-the-move program, commonly referred to as GBAD, allowing controllers to simply drive the weapon to a target . once drones are spotted, it can them shoot them out of the sky using a 30kw laser .

university of Illinois scientists have created the first 3D simulation of merging black holes in a disk . it shows what happens when two supermassive black holes collide . material swirls around the objects in the quasar and jets fire out from the poles in the merger . the simulation is particularly interesting because recent observations show two such black holes are going to collide in just seven years .

security researchers have found a way to intercept a person's fingerprints . the flaw is in older versions of the android operating system . it means that once a hacker has access they can monitor data recorded by built-in sensors, including the fingerprint scanner . when a fingerprint is scanned it is encrypted and separated from the rest of the phone . hackers typically can't access this encrypted file, but they can collect scans from the sensor before it becomes encrypted .

researchers at the university of huddersfield have created a technique which they claim can distinguish between the genetic fingerprints of identical twins . technique is called high resolution melt curve analysis - or HRMA . it subjects the DNA to increasingly high temperatures until the hydrogen bonds break, known as the melting temperature . the more hydrogen bonds that are present in the DNA, the higher the temperature required to melt them .

researchers from national chung hsing university in taiwan studied the expression of a class of genes known to be associated with petal development . they converted lips into petals in two orchid species by reducing the activity of the 'L' complex and 'SP' complex, using gene silencing . the study extends scientists' understanding of the mechanisms leading to the diverse beauty of orchid flowers .

a Harvard-led study has mapped taste buds on a tongue for the first time . scientists examined the different cells used to identify taste and watched these cells capture and process molecules live . they were able to spot blood vessels up to 240 microns - 240 millionths of a metre (0.0024mm) below the surface of the tongue . researchers say the sensory changes are tied to ancient climate-cooling events in Antarctica, where penguins originated .
